Calculate the relative dimension of a school

Source: R/schoolRelativeDimension.R
schoolRelativeDimension.Rd

This function calculates the relative school dimension of Diner (2001)

schoolRelativeDimension(Sv, L, P, Th, theta)

Arguments

Sv

Observed mean volume backscattering strength (Sv) of a school
L

Observed (uncorrected) school length, m
P

Mean depth of school
Th

Minimum Sv data threshold used to detect schools using the SHAPES algorithm
theta

Transducer 3 dB beam width, degrees

Value

Relative school dimension (Nb)

References

Diner, N. (2001). Correction on school geometry and density: approach based on acoustic image simulation. Aquatic Living Resources, 14(4), 211-222.

See also

EVSchoolsDetect EVIntegrationByRegionsExport
